Description: Recording system events and user actions for security auditing and compliance tracking
Related_Terms: audit, log, trail, wizard, category, thread

Description: Verifying user identity through credentials to ensure secure access to system resources
Related_Terms: credential, challenge, login, authorization

Description: Saving system state at intervals to enable recovery from failures without complete restart
Related_Terms: barrier, weak point, save state

Description: Reverting system to previous stable state when errors occur or transactions fail
Related_Terms: layoff, restraint, undo, revert

Description: Maintaining unused/backup resources that can be activated when primary resources fail
Related_Terms: backup, unused, option, spare capacity

Description: Creating duplicate copies of data/components to ensure availability and fault tolerance
Related_Terms: replication, redundant storage, geo-redundant, zone-redundant

Description: Using multiple redundant components to reach consensus through majority decision
Related_Terms: vote, ballot, consensus, majority

Description: Running parallel version of system in background to validate results without affecting main operation
Related_Terms: shadow mode, parallel execution

Description: Recording temporal information for events to enable ordering, synchronization, and auditing
Related_Terms: timestamp, time strap, temporal marker

Description: Validating data reasonableness and system state consistency to detect anomalies early
Related_Terms: sanity check, validation, reasonableness check

Description: Using alternative components with same function to maintain operation when primary fails
Related_Terms: functional backup, alternative implementation

Description: First-In-First-Out queue processing to ensure fair ordering and predictable behavior
Related_Terms: first in first out, queue, FIFO buffer

Description: Using mathematical models/algorithms to detect faults by comparing expected vs actual behavior
Related_Terms: parallel redundancy, warm restart, dual redundancy

Description: Protecting sensitive data through encryption, access control, and secure storage mechanisms
Related_Terms: data protection, encryption, confidentiality

Description: Detecting attacks and restoring system to secure operational state after breach
Related_Terms: attack recovery, breach response, restoration

Description: Recognizes and handles faults through exception mechanisms, informing exception handlers of detected faults
Related_Terms: exception handling, fault detection, error handling

Description: Keeps replicas of resources on separate repositories to reduce contention, using cache for frequently requested data
Related_Terms: caching, replication, data redundancy, CDN

Description: Protects data from unauthorized modifications using encryption and decryption mechanisms
Related_Terms: encryption, data protection, confidentiality, cryptography

Description: Maintains administrative data separately from user data and restores them separately for better security protection
Related_Terms: data separation, isolated recovery, admin data protection

Description: Increases cohesion to narrow modification scope, reducing cost of changes by keeping related components together
Related_Terms: high cohesion, encapsulation, modular design

Description: Avoids coupling between components to decrease modification range and prevent ripple effects across subsystems
Related_Terms: low coupling, loose coupling, independence, decoupling

Description: Enables late decision making and runtime modification by deferring binding time of components
Related_Terms: late binding, dynamic binding, runtime configuration, plugin architecture

Description: Divides system into modules or layers to isolate problems, facilitate testing and simplify analysis
Related_Terms: modular design, separation of concerns, layering, modularization

Description: Adds comments, process explanations, valid naming to increase understandability and simplify testing
Related_Terms: documentation, comments, meaningful names, self-documenting code

Description: Uses standards in artifacts to reduce learning time and increase understandability across team
Related_Terms: coding standards, design standards, conventions, best practices

Description: Increases hardware abstraction level using standard middleware to enhance portability across platforms
Related_Terms: hardware abstraction, platform independence, middleware, virtualization

Description: Synthesizes system based on environment-independent methods like CORBA or Java Beans
Related_Terms: platform abstraction, environment independence, cross-platform development

Description: Defines architecture formally to increase analyzability and enable formal verification
Related_Terms: formal methods, formal specification, ADL, architecture description language

Description: Maintains links between requirements, design and implementation to facilitate analysis and change impact assessment
Related_Terms: requirements traceability, design traceability, traceability matrix

Description: Addresses changes by adding entirely new components rather than modifying existing ones, enabling higher productivity
Related_Terms: component addition, extensibility, modular extension

Description: Extends existing components through plug-in mechanism for smaller changes, higher productivity than code modification
Related_Terms: plugin architecture, extension points, component extension

Description: Analyzes changes to software architecture and components required to incorporate change scenarios before implementation
Related_Terms: change impact analysis, dependency analysis, ripple effect analysis
